intro: Osteospermum arctotioides, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, daisy-like blooms with white petals surrounding a central disk of yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically gray-green and hairy, adapted to arid conditions. Osteospermum arctotioides is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
